Constructor Detail

SimpleXml

public SimpleXml(@NotNull
                 String text)
Public ctor, from XML as a text.

The object is created with a default implementation of NamespaceContext, which already defines a number of namespaces, for convenience, including: 

 xhtml: http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml
 xs: http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema
 xsi: http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance
 xsl: http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform
 svg: http://www.w3.org/2000/svg

In future versions we will add more namespaces (submit a ticket if you need more of them defined here).

Parameters:
text - Body

xpath

public List<String> xpath(@NotNull
                          String query)
Find and return text elements or attributes matched by XPath address.

The XPath query should point to text elements or attributes in the XML document. If any nodes of different types (elements, comments, etc.) are found in result node list - an AssertionError will be thrown.

This is a convenient method, which is used (according to our experience) in 95% of all cases. Usually you don't need to get anything else but a text value of some node or an attribute. And in most cases you are interested to get just the first value (use xpath(..).get(0)). But when/if you need to get more than just a plain text - use XmlDocument.nodes(String).

The List returned will throw NodeNotFoundException if you try to access a node which wasn't found by this XPath query.

Specified by:
xpath in interface XmlDocument
Parameters:
query - The XPath query
Returns:
The list of string values (texts)
See Also:
NodeNotFoundException

registerNs

public SimpleXml registerNs(@NotNull
                            String prefix,
                            @NotNull
                            Object uri)
Register additional namespace prefix for XPath.

For example: 

 String name = RestTester.start(new URI("http://www.example.com"))
   .registerNs("ns1", "http://example.com")
   .registerNs("foo", "http://example.com/foo")
   .xpath("/ns1:root/foo:name/text()")
   .get(0);

A number of standard namespaces are registered by default in instances of XmlDocument returned by RestTester. Their full list is in SimpleXml(String).

If a namespace prefix is already registered an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

Specified by:
registerNs in interface XmlDocument
Parameters:
prefix - The XPath prefix to register
uri - Namespace URI
Returns:
A new XML document, with this additional namespace registered

nodes

public List<XmlDocument> nodes(@NotNull
                               String query)
Retrieve DOM nodes from the XML response.

The List returned will throw NodeNotFoundException if you try to access a node which wasn't found by this XPath query.

Specified by:
nodes in interface XmlDocument
Parameters:
query - The XPath query
Returns:

See Also:

merge

public XmlDocument merge(@NotNull
                         NamespaceContext ctx)
Append this namespace context to the existing one.

The existing context (inside this object) and the new one provided will be merged together. The existing context will be have higher priority.

Specified by:
merge in interface XmlDocument
Parameters:
ctx - The context to append
Returns:
A new XML document, with a merged context on board
